intro: Peucedanum vaginatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cowparley, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant features slender stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a fine pubescence. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Peucedanum vaginatum is often found in moist, calcareous soils and can thrive in woodland or meadow habitats.
